data.title: The Little Prince
data.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
data.content: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.

data.title: Don Quixote
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
data.content: Too much sanity may be madness — and maddest of all: to see life as it is, and not as it should be!

data.title: Wuthering Heights
data.author: Emily Brontë
data.content: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same
